name: Grilled Ribeye Steak with Roasted Vegetables
ingredients: 2 ribeye steaks (1.5 inches thick, about 12 oz each)
2 cups mixed vegetables (broccoli, bell peppers, zucchini, carrots)
steps:
Remove steaks from refrigerator 30-45 minutes before cooking to bring to room temperature.
Preheat oven to 400Â°F for roasting vegetables.
Pat steaks dry with paper towels and season generously with salt and coarse black pepper on both sides.
Rub steaks with 1 tablespoon of olive oil and press chopped rosemary and thyme onto the surface.
Cut vegetables into uniform pieces. Toss with 2 tablespoons olive oil, minced garlic, salt, and pepper.
Spread vegetables on a baking sheet and roast in preheated oven for 15-20 minutes until tender and slightly charred.
While vegetables roast, heat a cast-iron skillet or grill pan over high heat until very hot.
Sear steaks for 4-5 minutes per side for medium-rare (adjust time based on desired doneness and steak thickness).
Add butter to the pan during the last minute of cooking and baste steaks with melted butter.
Remove steaks from heat and let rest on a cutting board for 5-10 minutes (this allows juices to redistribute).
Slice steaks against the grain into thick strips.
Serve steaks alongside roasted vegetables with lemon wedges on the side.
